If no such cases are confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Italy launch a mission to Mars involving a human crew by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the Italian Space Agency (ASI) or any Italy-based entity, in collaboration with international partners or independently, successfully launches a mission to Mars that includes at least one human crew member before January 1, 2040. The mission must achieve a successful launch, transit, and Mars orbit insertion or landing to be considered. If the mission is launched but fails to achieve orbit insertion or landing, the question will resolve as No. In the event of a mission announcement without a subsequent launch by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No. Verification will be based on official announcements from the Italian Space Agency, credible space exploration news sources, or direct evidence of the mission's success (e.g., telemetry data, mission updates). In the case of multiple missions, the resolution will be based on the first mission's success. If no mission is attempted, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a new genetic editing tool surpassing CRISPR-Cas9 in precision and efficiency be discovered by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, a new genetic editing tool is discovered and publicly documented to surpass CRISPR-Cas9 in both precision and efficiency. The assessment of "precision" and "efficiency" must be based on peer-reviewed scientific publications that compare the new tool directly with CRISPR-Cas9. The publications must be indexed in major scientific databases such as PubMed, Web of Science, or Scopus. The discovery must be recognized and validated by at least two independent research institutions or a leading scientific committee in the field of genetics. In the event of multiple claims of discovery, the resolution will be based on the earliest documented and verified claim. If no such tool is discovered by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will a professional golfer announce a candidacy for a major political office by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by 11:59 PM UTC on December 31, 2025, a professional golfer who has participated in at least one of the four major golf championships (The Masters, the U.S. Open, The Open Championship, or the PGA Championship) publicly announces their candidacy for a major political office. A 'major political office' is defined as a position that is part of the legislative, executive, or judicial branch of government at the national or state/provincial level, or a mayoral position in a city with a population of at least 300,000 residents. The announcement must be verifiable through credible media reports or an official statement from the golfer or their representative. If the golfer retracts their candidacy before the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. In the event that no such announcement is made, or if the golfer's professional status or the political office's significance is ambiguous, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will an international AI ethics board be established to regulate AI development and usage by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, an international AI ethics board is officially formed and recognized by at least five of the following entities: the United Nations (UN), the European Union (EU), the United States, China, India, Russia, and Japan. The board must be tasked with creating guidelines, standards, or regulations for the development and usage of artificial intelligence technologies on a global scale. The formation of the board must be documented by at least two reputable global news organizations. In the event that multiple boards are established, the question will resolve as Yes only if there is a consensus among the aforementioned entities to recognize a single board as the primary international regulatory body. If no such board is established, or if there is no consensus on a primary board by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the first direct image of an exoplanet's surface be captured by astronomers by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, astronomers have captured and publicly released a direct image of an exoplanet's surface, where a "direct image" is defined as an image obtained without the use of indirect methods such as transit photometry or radial velocity measurements. The image must clearly depict surface features such as continents, oceans, or ice caps, and must be verified by at least two independent and reputable astronomical institutions (e.g., NASA, ESA, or a similar level of authority). In the event that multiple claims of direct imaging are made, the question will resolve in favor of the first verified claim. If no such image has been publicly released by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In cases where verification is pending as of the resolution date, the question will remain open until a conclusive verification is provided or until it is clear that no verification will be forthcoming.

title: Will a major global IT company experience a data breach affecting over 100 million users before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, a data breach is publicly confirmed by either the affected company, a reputable cybersecurity firm, or a major news outlet to have exposed the personal data of over 100 million users of a single, identifiable global IT company. The breach must involve unauthorized access to personal data such as names, email addresses, passwords, or financial information. The data breach must be distinct and not a cumulative total of smaller breaches over time. In the absence of a public confirmation, credible reports from multiple independent and reputable cybersecurity researchers or news outlets will be considered sufficient for resolution. If the company in question disputes the claim but the evidence is overwhelmingly in favor of a breach having occurred, the question will resolve as Yes. In cases where the data number is close to 100 million but not definitively over, a margin of error of 1% will be allowed for the resolution.

title: Will the James Webb Space Telescope discover a previously unknown exoplanet that is confirmed to be Earth-like by 2030?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has discovered at least one previously unknown exoplanet that meets all of the following criteria:

- Located within the habitable zone of its star, where conditions may allow for the presence of liquid water on the surface.
- Possesses an atmosphere with chemical signatures indicative of biological activity, similar to those sought in current exoplanet research (e.g., oxygen, ozone, methane).
- Confirmed through follow-up observations by either JWST itself or other telescopes capable of exoplanet characterization.

An exoplanet will be considered 'Earth-like' based on the above criteria and must be confirmed by a recognized authority in the field, such as the NASA Exoplanet Archive or the European Space Agency.

In the event that multiple exoplanets are discovered that meet these criteria, the question will resolve as Yes upon the confirmation of the first such exoplanet. If no such discovery is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

Should the JWST become inoperable or unable to perform the necessary observations before the resolution date, an alternative authoritative source or mission capable of similar discoveries will be considered valid for the resolution of this question.

title: Will OpenAI release a new language model that significantly outperforms GPT-4 by 2025?
body:
The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2024, OpenAI releases a new language model that meets all of the following criteria:

Significant Performance Improvement: The new model must demonstrate a clear and significant improvement over GPT-4 in at least three of the following areas: natural language understanding, natural language generation, computational efficiency, and task-specific benchmarks. The improvement must be quantifiable, with at least a 15% increase in performance metrics compared to GPT-4.

Public Availability: The model must be made publicly available, either through OpenAI's API or as a downloadable software package, allowing for independent verification of its capabilities.

Peer Review: The model's performance improvements must be documented and verified through a peer-reviewed publication or an equivalent authoritative source.

In the event that OpenAI is rebranded, merges with another entity, or undergoes significant organizational changes, the resolution will still apply to the entity responsible for the development and release of the language model.

title: Will an infectious disease outbreak occur on a spacecraft or space station resulting in a quarantine situation by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, there is a confirmed case of an infectious disease outbreak on a spacecraft or space station that leads to an official quarantine situation. An "infectious disease outbreak" is defined as the occurrence of cases of disease in excess of what would normally be expected in a defined community, group, or area. A "quarantine situation" refers to the imposition of restrictions on the movement of people, animals, or goods which are designed to prevent the spread of disease or pests. The confirmation must come from an official space agency (e.g., NASA, ESA, Roscosmos, CNSA, ISRO) or a recognized health organization (e.g., WHO, CDC). In the event that multiple outbreaks occur, the resolution will be based on the first confirmed case. If no such outbreak is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No. Edge cases or disputes will be resolved based on the most reliable and authoritative information available at the time of resolution.

title: Will a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology be attributed to research conducted in Virginia by the end of 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2030, a major scientific breakthrough in renewable energy technology is officially recognized and attributed to research conducted in Virginia. A "major scientific breakthrough" is defined as a discovery or development that significantly enhances the efficiency, cost-effectiveness, or sustainability of renewable energy sources, such as solar, wind, hydroelectric, or geothermal energy. The breakthrough must be documented in a peer-reviewed scientific journal or officially recognized by a leading global energy organization (e.g., International Renewable Energy Agency, World Energy Council). The breakthrough should represent a clear advancement beyond the current state of the art and have the potential for widespread application or significant impact on the renewable energy sector. In the case of multiple claims, the earliest documented and verified discovery will be considered. If no such breakthrough is publicly recognized by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Information Technology be the primary industry driving space exploration investments by 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2029, more than 50% of the total documented financial investment in space exploration comes from companies whose primary business is Information Technology, including but not limited to software development, hardware manufacturing, cloud computing, and data processing. This assessment will be based on financial reports, market analysis, and investment tracking by authoritative financial and industry analysis firms such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or similar. In cases where direct financial data is not available, credible market estimates will be considered. Investments by subsidiaries of IT companies will be counted towards this total, provided the subsidiary's primary business aligns with the IT sector. If there is ambiguity in determining the primary industry of a company, the most recent fiscal year's revenue source breakdown will be used as the deciding factor. Edge cases, such as investments made by conglomerates with significant but not primary IT operations, will be evaluated on a case-by-case basis, with a preference for transparency and the most straightforward interpretation of 'primary industry.' Should there be significant changes in industry definitions or classifications before the resolution date, an updated assessment may be conducted to ensure fairness and accuracy in resolving the question.

title: Will the first vaccine for a space-related pathogen be developed by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, a vaccine has been developed, tested, and officially approved for a pathogen that is identified as originating from or being uniquely associated with space environments (e.g., microorganisms found on extraterrestrial bodies or in the space station environment). The vaccine must be recognized and approved by a major health organization such as the World Health Organization (WHO) or the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC). The development of the vaccine must be documented and verified through peer-reviewed scientific publications or official statements from the approving health organization. In the case where multiple vaccines are developed, the resolution will consider the first vaccine that meets these criteria. If no such vaccine is developed by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. In the event of ambiguity regarding the origin of the pathogen, a panel of experts convened by the WHO will make the final determination.

title: Will the US House of Representatives pass a significant bill funding scientific research in biology by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the US House of Representatives passes a bill that allocates at least $1 billion USD to scientific research in the field of biology. The bill must be specifically aimed at funding research in areas such as genetics, molecular biology, cellular biology, and biotechnology. The funding must be new or additional, not a reallocation of existing funds. The bill's passage is defined as the successful vote in the House of Representatives, followed by the President's signature into law. In the event of a government shutdown or other significant political event that prevents the passage of any legislation, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will be based on official statements from the US House of Representatives and the White House, as well as coverage in major media outlets.

title: Will there be a new technology used at the 2028 Olympics to enhance viewer experience that allows for real-time athlete biometrics tracking?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2028 Summer Olympics, a new technology is introduced and used that enables real-time tracking of athlete biometrics (such as heart rate, oxygen levels, and muscle activity) during competitions. The technology must be officially adopted and utilized in at least one Olympic sport by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or a recognized governing body for the sport. The technology's use must be confirmed through official announcements, broadcasts, or reports from credible sources. In the case of multiple technologies being introduced, the resolution will consider the technology that is most widely implemented across different sports. If the technology is introduced but not used due to unforeseen circumstances (e.g., technical failures, last-minute regulatory issues), the question will still resolve as Yes, provided there was an official plan to use it. If the technology is used in practice sessions but not in actual competitions, the question will not resolve as Yes.

title: What is the probability that a space exploration policy will be a significant topic in the 2024 US presidential election debates?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if space exploration policy is discussed in at least one of the official 2024 US presidential election debates. A "significant topic" is defined as a topic that is discussed for a minimum of 5 continuous minutes or receives at least 5 distinct mentions by the candidates or moderators during a single debate. The debates in question must be part of the official debate schedule recognized by the Federal Election Commission (FEC). Verification will be based on transcripts provided by a reputable source such as the Commission on Presidential Debates or major news outlets (e.g., CNN, BBC, The New York Times). In the event that space exploration policy is mentioned but does not meet the criteria for "significant," the question will resolve as No. If no official debates address space exploration policy, the question will also resolve as No. In the case of ambiguity or lack of clear transcripts, the resolution will defer to the most widely accepted interpretation by major news outlets.

title: Will a new form of energy be utilized for space travel, replacing traditional chemical rockets, by 2040?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2040, a new form of energy, distinct from traditional chemical rocket propulsion, is used to power a spacecraft for interplanetary travel, and meets the following criteria:

- The spacecraft must complete at least one successful journey between Earth and another celestial body (e.g., the Moon, Mars) using the new energy form as its primary propulsion method.

- The new form of energy must be the main source of propulsion for the spacecraft and must not rely on chemical rockets for more than 10% of the total propulsion throughout the journey.

- The utilization of the new energy form must be confirmed by at least two independent and reputable space agencies or organizations (e.g., NASA, ESA, SpaceX).

- The event must be documented and publicly disclosed through official reports, press releases, or peer-reviewed scientific publications.

In the event that multiple new forms of energy are utilized, the question will resolve as Yes if at least one meets the above criteria.

If no new form of energy is utilized by the specified date, or if the use of such energy does not meet the above criteria, the question will resolve as No.

Fallback scenario: If the journey is underway but not completed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as Yes only if the spacecraft has already demonstrated the new energy form's capability in interplanetary travel without relying on chemical rockets for more than 10% of the journey.

title: Will Major League Baseball adopt an automated strike zone system by the 2025 season?
body: Resolution criteria: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2025 Major League Baseball season, the MLB has officially adopted and implemented an automated strike zone system for use in regular season games. The system must be used across all MLB teams and be the primary method for determining balls and strikes during the game. The adoption must be confirmed through official MLB press releases, statements from the MLB Commissioner, or through the MLB's official rules and regulations documentation. In the event of a partial implementation (e.g., used only in certain stadiums or for a limited number of games), the question will resolve as No unless the MLB announces a clear, time-bound plan for full implementation before the end of the 2025 season. If the 2025 season is significantly delayed or canceled, the resolution date will be extended to the start of the 2026 season.

title: Will Canada implement a nationwide carbon tax by the end of 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the Government of Canada has passed legislation that imposes a carbon tax on greenhouse gas emissions across all provinces and territories of Canada. The tax must be applicable to individuals, businesses, and organizations, and must be in effect nationwide. The resolution will be based on official statements from the Government of Canada, legislative documents, or national news outlets recognized by the Canadian Press. In the event of a partial implementation or a commitment without actual enforcement, the question will resolve as No. If the tax is repealed or not enforced by the resolution date, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will the first professional basketball game be played in space before 2050?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if a professional basketball game is played in space before January 1, 2050. For the purposes of this question, a "professional basketball game" is defined as a game that involves two teams from any established professional basketball league (e.g., NBA, EuroLeague, CBA) playing a standard regulation game under the official rules of that league, with the following modifications allowed for the environment of space:

- Adjustments to the court size and equipment to accommodate microgravity conditions.
- Use of specialized space suits designed for athletic performance.
- Modifications to game rules to ensure player safety and accommodate the unique conditions of space.

The game must be officially sanctioned by the league and recognized as a professional game. It must be completed in its entirety, and any game that is started but not completed for any reason will not count towards this question's resolution.

In the event that multiple leagues claim to have held the first professional basketball game in space, the game that is first completed in full, according to the official timekeeping of the event, will be considered the qualifying event. If no professional basketball game is played in space by the deadline, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will the value of the US dollar be directly affected by a nuclear incident before 2030?
body: The question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, there is a nuclear incident that directly affects the value of the US dollar. A 'nuclear incident' is defined as an unplanned event or series of events that have caused or could cause significant harm to people, the environment, or property, including but not limited to nuclear accidents, detonation of a nuclear weapon, or significant radioactive contamination. The 'value of the US dollar' will be considered directly affected if there is a change of more than 5% in the USD index (DXY) within a 30-day period that can be directly attributed to the nuclear incident by reports from at least three major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal). In the absence of such an incident, the question will resolve as No. If the nuclear incident occurs but the direct effect on the US dollar's value cannot be established, the question will also resolve as No. In the event of conflicting reports or ambiguity in attribution, the question will be resolved by a panel of three economic experts, whose decision will be final.

title: Will Brazil's inflation rate exceed 10% in any year before 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if the annual inflation rate in Brazil, as reported by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics (IBGE), exceeds 10% in any year before January 1, 2025. The inflation rate to be considered is the National Consumer Price Index (IPCA), which is the official measure used by the Brazilian government to monitor inflation trends. The resolution will be based on the final and official IPCA figures for each year, as initially reported by the IBGE, without subsequent revisions. If the IBGE ceases to exist, is unable to report the IPCA, or the IPCA is no longer the official measure of inflation, the question will resolve using the data from the next most authoritative source that is recognized by the Brazilian Central Bank. In the event of hyperinflation leading to a change in currency or a re-denomination of the Brazilian real, the percentage increase will be calculated based on the value of the new currency unit relative to the real at the time of the change.

title: Will any cryptocurrency be accepted as an official payment method for tickets at the 2024 Summer Olympics?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by the start of the 2024 Summer Olympics, any cryptocurrency is officially accepted by the International Olympic Committee (IOC) or the Paris Olympic Organizing Committee as a payment method for purchasing tickets to the events. Official acceptance is defined as a public announcement or statement from the IOC, the Paris Olympic Organizing Committee, or the official Olympic ticketing partner that explicitly states cryptocurrency as an accepted form of payment. This includes payments made directly on the official Olympics ticketing website, through official ticketing partners, or at physical ticket sales points designated by the organizing committees. The resolution will consider all forms of cryptocurrency, including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and any others that may be recognized as valid for transactions. In the event that the acceptance of cryptocurrency is announced and then retracted before the start of the Olympics, the question will resolve as No. If no official announcement is made by the start of the Olympics, the question will also resolve as No.

title: Will an international space mission be aborted due to ethical concerns by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2025, an international space mission (defined as a mission involving two or more countries' space agencies or private space entities) is officially canceled, postponed indefinitely, or significantly altered in scope due to ethical concerns raised either by the public, participating entities' internal ethics boards, or international regulatory bodies. Ethical concerns may include, but are not limited to, issues related to human rights, environmental impact, the use of AI, and the treatment of animals. The cancellation, postponement, or alteration must be publicly acknowledged by the leading organization(s) of the mission and reported by at least two reputable international news outlets. In the event that multiple missions meet these criteria, the resolution will be based on the first such occurrence. If no such mission is publicly acknowledged to be affected by ethical concerns by the specified date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will any candidate from the Republican Party win the popular vote in the 2024 US presidential election?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if a candidate from the Republican Party wins the majority of the popular vote in the 2024 US presidential election, as reported by the Federal Election Commission (FEC) or any other authoritative and non-partisan source recognized for election reporting. In the event of a dispute or recount, the question will resolve based on the final, certified election results. If no candidate from the Republican Party participates in the 2024 presidential election, the question will resolve as No. The resolution will not consider any votes that are declared invalid or are subject to legal challenges that could change the outcome.

title: Will Brazil have an operational nuclear-powered submarine by 2035?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2035, the Brazilian Navy has commissioned and has in operational service at least one nuclear-powered submarine. The submarine must be capable of performing military operations and not solely for training or testing purposes. The operational status should be confirmed by official statements from the Brazilian Navy or the Brazilian government, or by credible reporting from established defense or maritime industry publications. If the submarine is operational but restricted from use due to international sanctions, treaties, or environmental concerns, the question will still resolve as Yes. In the event that the Brazilian Navy has a nuclear-powered submarine under construction but not yet operational, or if the status is unclear as of the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will NATO launch a joint space mission with non-member countries by 2030?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, before January 1, 2030, NATO officially announces and initiates a joint space mission involving at least one non-member country. The mission must be beyond preliminary talks or agreements and should have a clear objective, timeline, and designated resources. The announcement must come from an official NATO communication channel or a press release from the participating countries' governments. In the case of ambiguity regarding the mission's status or the involvement of non-member countries, the resolution will defer to the most recent and authoritative public statement made by NATO or the governments of the involved countries. If no such mission is announced or initiated by the specified date, the question will resolve as No. For the purpose of this question, a 'joint space mission' is defined as a collaborative effort in space exploration, research, or development that involves significant operational, technological, or financial collaboration between NATO members and non-member countries. This includes, but is not limited to, manned and unmanned missions to outer space, satellite deployments, and space station modules.

title: Will California lead the United States in the number of electric vehicle charging stations per capita by 2025?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the state of California has the highest number of electric vehicle (EV) charging stations per capita compared to all other states in the United States. The count of EV charging stations will be based on the data provided by the U.S. Department of Energy's Alternative Fuels Data Center (AFDC) or its successor agency. Per capita calculations will be based on the most recent U.S. Census Bureau population estimates for each state as of December 31, 2025. In the event that the AFDC is no longer active or does not provide the necessary data, the resolution will be based on the most authoritative and comprehensive dataset available at that time. If no reliable data can be obtained, the question will resolve as N/A (Not Applicable).

title: Will Sweden become the first European country to fully replace its national currency with a cryptocurrency by 2040?
body: This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2039, the Swedish government officially declares the complete replacement of the Swedish krona (SEK) with a cryptocurrency as the sole legal tender for all types of financial transactions within Sweden. This includes, but is not limited to, retail purchases, taxes, and government fees. The cryptocurrency must be recognized by the Swedish Central Bank and must function as the primary medium of exchange, unit of account, and store of value across the country. The transition must be fully implemented, with the krona no longer being legally recognized for any financial transaction within Sweden. In the event that multiple countries in Europe achieve this milestone simultaneously, or if another European country has already replaced its national currency with a cryptocurrency before Sweden, this question will resolve as No. The resolution will rely on official statements from the Swedish government, the Swedish Central Bank, or any authoritative financial regulatory bodies in Sweden. In the absence of clear evidence by the resolution date, the question will resolve as No.

title: Will Germany announce the commencement of a major public infrastructure project involving significant engineering advancements by 2025?
body:
This question will resolve as Yes if, by December 31, 2025, the German government or any of its federal states officially announces the commencement of a major public infrastructure project that includes significant engineering advancements. The project must meet the following criteria:

- The project is publicly announced by an official government source, such as a press release, official statement, or government spokesperson.

- The project involves the construction, upgrade, or expansion of physical infrastructure, such as transportation networks, energy systems, or public buildings.

- The project incorporates significant engineering advancements, which are defined as novel technologies or methods that represent a substantial improvement over existing solutions in terms of efficiency, sustainability, or functionality. Examples include, but are not limited to, the use of smart materials, automation in construction processes, or innovative energy solutions.

- The project has a planned or actual start date within six months of the announcement.

In the event that multiple projects are announced, the resolution will be based on the first project that meets all the above criteria.

If no such project is announced by the specified date, or if the project announced does not meet the criteria outlined above, the question will resolve as No.

In case of ambiguity regarding the significance of the engineering advancements, a panel of three experts in the field of civil engineering, appointed by Metaculus Admins, will determine whether the project meets the criteria. Their decision will be considered final for the purpose of resolving this question.
